page.title: 02PEOPLE AND WHAT THEY DO
page.content: Statistics we have gathered show that we are an aging population,with the implications that entails-falling school rolls and an extra load on welfare facilities.There is a slight imbalance between male and female-85 females,79 males.The immigrants outnumber the Cornish-Cornish 78, others 86.The largest group of residents(48)have been in the area for 5 years or less,22 have always lived here and 41 have lived here for over 20 years.Much will depend on whether the newcomers have integrated with local people.Most seem keen to join in.A low level of unemployment is accounted for by the fact that most farms are family businesses.Out of 105 people,5 were unemployed,30 retired,19 were self-employed,19 were at school or college and 32 were wage or salary earners.
